result.rationale: Copadichromis diplostigma is endemic to Lake Malawi and occurs only around Likoma Island. It meets the area requirements under criterion B for Critically Endangered and it is known from one location. However, future declines in population size are possible but uncertain. The effects of subsistence fishing on this species are unknown and it is, therefore, listed as Near Threatened.
result.geographicrange: This species is endemic to Likoma Island (Malawi) in Lake Malawi.
result.population: No information is available on the population size and population trend of this species.
result.habitat: This species frequents habitats characterised by sandy bottoms with scattered rocks and stones; here territorial males construct bowers at the sand/rock interface at depths of 12–18 m (Stauffer and Konings 2006). Females and immature males occur in small groups and feed on plankton in the water column and on benthic invertebrates (Stauffer and Konings 2006).
result.threats: Subsistence fishing using chirimila nets is a potential threat.
result.conservationmeasures: No conservation actions are known for this species. Research is recommended.
result.usetrade: This species is not targeted by the ornamental fish trade, but is targeted by utaka fishermen.
